intro: Amomum tomrey, commonly known as the greater galangal, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the ginger family (Zingiberaceae) and is characterized by its aromatic, rhizomatous root system. The plant produces tall, narrow leaves and small, pale yellow flowers that appear in clusters. Its rhizomes are widely used in traditional medicine and as a culinary spice due to their distinctive flavor and medicinal properties. Amomum tomrey thrives in warm, humid climates and is often cultivated for its aromatic rhizomes.
